name: 量化方法與Ｒ語言實作
description: This course provides an overview of statistical models in linguistics and hands-on programming with R. No background in statistics or prior knowledge of R is assumed. The course begins with an overview of descriptive and inferential statistics. The statistical program R will be used throughout the course. By the end of the course, students should have a thorough knowledge of many statistical models used in modern linguistics and an ability to perform statistical analyses with R.
goals: Gain the fundamental concepts in statistics
Demonstrate the ability to conduct statistical analyses with R
syllabus:

Week 1:Course Overview—R and RStudio

Week 2: Probability Theory; BasicData Manipulation and Graphical Displays in R

Week 3: Descriptive Statistics and Sampling

Week 4: Hypothesis testing

Week 5: Hypothesis testing

Week 6: z-tests and t-tests: Comparing Two Means

Week 7: Chi-square Tests: Categorical Data Analysis

Week 8: Analysis of Variance (ANOVA): Comparing Several Means

Week 9: Analysis of Variance (ANOVA): Comparing Several Means

Week 10:Midterm Exam

Week 11: Factor Level Means; Diagnostics

Week 12: Two-way ANOVA; Experimental Design

Week 13: Linear regression

Week 14: Linear regression

Week 15: Repeated Measures; Random and Mixed Effects Models

Week 16: Repeated Measures; Random and Mixed Effects Models

Week 17: Logistic regression; GLM

Week 18: Final Exam
